instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-02773: What is 820-02773? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: Mbp <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02773</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> M2 2022 no touchbar
threads.message:
Hi fellows. After a liquid spill and previous repair attempts, I’ve managed to get the MacBook Pro to boot, but the touchpad isn't working. I’ve tried using a different top case, but it didn't have any effect. I’ve looked at the schematics and are trying to understand it, but need assistance. On RT702, I get 1.76 volts on both sides, but nothing is coming out from QT700. I am wondering if power only flows when the LID is active. Is there anyone who can guide me in the right direction?
Thx

threads.title: Mbp <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02773</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> M2 2022 no touchbar
threads.message:
The same signal <SIGNAL>IPD_LID_OPEN_1V8</SIGNAL> goes to trackpad.
Is good of course, if trackpad works.
And QT700 can't open, being P-channel MOSFET; that's correct.
In fact even the name, <SIGNAL>DFR_LID_OPEN_L</SIGNAL> specifies to be low (0V), when lid is open.

Check other voltages and signals on JT700; compare with good board, if possible.
